Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.core
Package.Title: Core
Package.Description: Meta package

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.lp_SimpleKeyer
Package.Title: lp_SimpleKeyer
Package.Description: A very simple Keyer for a wide variety of operations.Inspired by Nukes Keyer-Node.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.lp_Despot
Package.Title: lp_Despot
Package.Description: Despots for black or white pixels.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.Z2Normal
Package.Title: Z2Normal
Package.Description: Generate a Normal Pass from a Z pass

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.ReFlect
Package.Title: ReFlect
Package.Description: Take a Normal pass and an image and map it to reflection, similar to matcap in 3D render

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.ChromaticAberrationPP
Package.Title: ChormaticAberrationPP
Package.Description:
This PyPlug mimics the optical effect called "chromatic aberration".

It occurs because lenses have different refractive indices for different wave lengths of light (also known as: dispersion) resulting in different convergence points for each wave length.
Normally this is an unwanted effect which the producers of lens systems try to minimize as much as possible. But if used subtly, it can help cg elements to look a bit more naturally and of course it can be used as a nice effect for motion graphics.

Actually there are two types of chromatic aberration:
1. Axial Chromatic Aberration
The axial chromatic abberation occurs because parallel incoming light of different wavelengths is focused on different planes. (As long as the lenses are not corrected) So the green image may be sharp, because it's focus is perfectly aligned with the photosensor, but the blue and the red image might be a bit blurred, because their focus can be slightly off.
This kind of chromatic aberration is present all over the image. It's noticable especially at the high contrast areas.

2. Lateral Chromatic Aberration
The lateral chromatic aberration will only occure at the periphery of the image. If light falls in from an angle the dispersion causes the light of different wave lengths to focus at different points on the sensor/film. This results in slightly shifted color channels at the periphery, if the lens is not corrected.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.EdgeBlur
Package.Title: EdgeBlur
Package.Description:
Blur the image according to the edges of the Alpha provided.

Useful to better integrate an image over another in a compositing.
This can help also to fix artifacts caused by a DOF filter....

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.Shaker
Package.Title: Shaker
Package.Description:
This PyPlug adds a shaking effect to the input image. 
It's based on an expression similar to the 'wiggle' expression known from After Effects.

It also supports two methods to extend the image and get rid of the black areas which normally occure while shaking.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.LightWrap_Simple
Package.Title: LightWrap_Simple
Package.Description: An alternative to built-in LightWrap plugin, simpler to use, also it as an option to dilate wrap to get a bigger effect

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.lp_Tweaky
Package.Title: lp_Tweaky
Package.Description: Provides a variety of little tweaking-options, like Vibrance, WB-Slider, Tint, etc.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.Defocus
Package.Title: Defocus
Package.Description:
Add a bokeh blur to the image. You can use an image to guide blur size. 
It's not suited to act as a ZBlur plugin ( to fake DOF using a Zpass ) . But in some cases it can work.
Typicall use case can be to blur the bakground image in a composite to match the blur of the foreground.

Credits : 
Orginal Shader by David Hoskins
License Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-ShareAlike 3.0 Unported License.
https://www.shadertoy.com/view/4d2Xzw

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.lp_CleanScreen
Package.Title: lp_CleanScreen
Package.Description: Evens out your Chroma-Screen with the help of a Cleanplate.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.lp_ColourSmear
Package.Title: lp_ColourSmear
Package.Description: Smears the colors around a given Alpha.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.lp_NoiseDistort
Package.Title: lp_NoiseDistort
Package.Description: Distorts an image based on two different noise-layer for a more dynamic feel.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.ReShade
Package.Title: ReShade
Package.Description: GPU Relighting of 3D renders using a normal pass.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.lp_Despill
Package.Title: lp_Despill
Package.Description: An alternative to buit-in Despill node that is quick and easy to setup.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.Vignette
Package.Title: Vignette
Package.Description: This effect adds a vignette to the image. \nA vignette is a reduction of the images brightness at the peripherie compared to the image center.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.ZCombine
Package.Title: ZCombine
Package.Description: Mix two images according to their Zbuffer.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.FrameStamp
Package.Title: FrameStamp
Package.Description: A very simple stamp that show the current frame in the corner of the image.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.lp_fakeDefocus
Package.Title: lp_fakeDefocus
Package.Description: A very faky Defocus. Very faky. Not very good. Might work for tiny things.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.lp_HairKey
Package.Title: lp_HairKey
Package.Description: A keyless Keyer for fine detail like hair which is hard to come by with a matte.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.PM_VectorBlur
Package.Title: PM_VectorBlur
Package.Description:
Poor Man's Vector Blur.
Blur an image according to a Vector/Motion Pass.

It works but it's very basic so things like good occlusions or way to prevent bleeding is not supported.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.Chromatic_Aberration
Package.Title: Chromatic Aberration
Package.Description: Create a Chromatic Aberration effect, similar to the one found in Blender.

Package.Name: natron.community.plugins.Orton
Package.Title: Orton
Package.Description: Orton Effect.
